stepTitle: Suppose you first walk leg B, which is $$20.0$$ $$m$$ in a direction exactly $$40$$ degrees south of west, and then leg A, which is $$12.0$$ $$m$$ in a direction exactly $$20$$ degrees west of north. How far are you from your starting point? (If you represent the two legs of the walk as vector displacements A and B, as in Figure $$3.51$$, then this problem is asking to find their vector sum.)
